page.title: 09CONSERVATION SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: East Farm,Hammoon and Bere Marsh Farm,Shillingstone,acquired in 1955 and 1971 by Mrs.A.Hughes make a dairy farm of 162 hectares.The conservation features are of great importance and consist of 3m.of one bank of the river Stour;an old woodland of 7.5 hectares;5m. of hedgerow;10 ponds;2m.of disused railway line; old permanent river pastures and a series of small spinnies.In 1970 and 1980 major Farming and Wildlife conferenceswere held which studied the farm in depth. Over 60 scientists and 60 farmers attended and two comprehensive reports were published by Dorset County Council.The following page lists the species of wildlife seen and identified on the farm over the last 30 years. A.Hughes.
